title: Senior Security Supervisor
content:
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world.
JD Sports Fashion Plc was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1996 and has been a FTSE100 publicly quoted company since 2019 and continues to grow in the UK and internationally.
We want to be the leading global omnichannel retailer in the sports and outdoor industry. To be a part of this successful company and help us to achieve this you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people-led, innovative and customer-focused organisation which provides operational excellence whilst identifying new areas of growth as part of our day to day objectives.
 
Key Duties/Responsibilities:
 
 

To maintain regular, high visibility patrols are conducted within the warehouse areas.

 

To ensure all provided security equipment is in proper use at all times.

 

To conduct regular and thorough staff searches using the guidelines set down by the Profit Protection Director and detailed within the Company Operations Manual.

 

To monitor the accurate checking of all seal numbers on arriving and departing delivery vehicles.

 

To randomly check and properly supervise any night-time closing procedure at Head Office to ensure the building is properly alarmed and all lights extinguished, windows closed etc. when not occupied.

 

To ensure regular car park patrols are carried out to prevent both thefts and unauthorised parking.
To ensure an accurate and up to date record is kept of all duties performed by all security officers and reviewed weekly.

 

To ensure fire doors are kept clear of obstructions and properly alarmed.
To ensure all fire fighting equipment is maintained and readily available.
To attend call-outs as necessary across different sites.
To install covert video equipment as directed

 

To review CCTV evidence from stores and Head Office, obtain photographs with the equipment provided and copy tapes as necessary and maintain accurate records.
To maintain an accurate key logging system of spare keys required for Head Office and distribution centres
To issue replacement keys or access cards when authorised to do so.
To ensure any goods/stock leaving Head Office/ Distribution Centre is properly accounted for.
To oversee the departure of damaged goods being sold to traders or dealers.
To properly supervise all security staff and ensure best practice is adhered to at all times.
To randomly check and ensure the accuracy of all goods being returned to suppliers for credit.
To randomly check all Parcel force parcels before being despatched from the warehouse.
To monitor the training/development of security guards and keep the Distribution Security Manager updated accordingly.

 

To ensure all security guards are subjected to regular and thorough searches in accordance with the Company Operations Manual.
To ensure random searches of security guard vehicles are carried out and records of searches filed.
To make alterations to guarding rotas when appropriate and maintain the required staffing levels in consultation with the Distribution Security Manager.
To Cover shifts occasionally at short notice to ensure a supervisory individual is present at all times.

 

To deputise for the distribution security manager in his absence.

 

To complete any ad-hoc tasks within the current levels of responsibilities as requested by the Distribution Security Manager.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We know our employees work tirelessly to make JD Sports the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

Staff Discount On JD Group and other brands within the organisation Pension Scheme
Flexible Working Hours
Health plans â€“ Depending on level of role
Personal development opportunities to learn and develop at work.

Due to the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it takes time to review them all. If you don't hear back within two weeks of you applying, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful on this occasion
Applications that meet the skills criteria will be contacted for a 1st stage meeting with the talent team. Shortlisted candidates will then be invited to interview with the hiring manager.
Thank you again for your time.
